required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anlotinib Plus Toripalimab as First-line Treatment for Advanced Gastric or Gastro-esophageal Junction Cancer (APICAL-GE)
clinical_study.official_title: Anlotinib Plus Toripalimab as First-line Treatment for Patients With Advanced Gastric or Gastro-esophageal Junction Cancer (APICAL-GE): a Single Center, Single-arm Phase II Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of the combination of Anlotinib wiht Toripalimab in advanced gastric or gastro-oesophageal junction cancer as first-line treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: Anlotinib is a new, orally administered tyrosine kinase inhibitor that targets vascular endothelial growth factor receptor (VEGFR), fibroblast growth factor receptor (FGFR), platelet-derived growth factor receptors (PDGFR), and c-kit. Toripalimab is a humanized immunoglobulin (Ig) G4 monoclonal antibody directed against the negative immunoregulatory human cell surface receptor programmed cell death 1 (programmed death-1; PD-1), with potential immune checkpoint inhibitory and antineoplastic activities. In the present study, we design a single-arm, single center Phase II trial to evaluate the efficacy and safety of the combination of Anlotinib wiht Toripalimab in advanced gastric or gastro-oesophageal junction cancer as first-line treatment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation of tumor burden based on RECIST criteria through study completion, an average of 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with reduction in tumor burden of a predefined amount, including complete remission and partial remission

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation of tumor burden based on RECIST criteria until first documented progress through study completion, an average of 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Time from treatment beginning until disease progression

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of treatment beginning until the date of death from any cause, through study completion, an average of 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Time from treatment beginning until death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation of tumor burden based on RECIST criteria through study completion, an average of 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Investigation of depth of response during first-line treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation of tumor burden based on RECIST criteria through study completion, an average of 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with reduction and non-change in tumor burden of a predefined amount, including complete remission, partial remission and stable disease

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 weeks

arm_group.description: the combination of Anlotinib Plus Toripalimab as first-line treatment

intervention.description: Anlotinib 12mg oral administration daily d1-d14, q3w; Toripalimab 240mg iv drop d1, q3w

facility.name: Department of Medical Oncology, Shanghai Changzheng Hospital
